title: Period of SHM - frequency after mass change

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to a horizontal spring and undergoes simple harmonic motion with frequency <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The block is then removed from the spring and replaced with a block of mass <math alttext="the fraction m over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>, and this new block undergoes simple harmonic motion with frequency <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="f sub 2 to f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
